alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:11PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A gusty outflow boundary will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, Taylor, eastern Lewis, Upshur, Barbour and eastern Harrison Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty outflow boundary from Walkersville northeast to Meadland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Buckhannon, Grafton, Weston, Philippi, Audra State Park, Bridgeport, Belington, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Anmoore, Stonewall Jackson, Rock Cave, Junior, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flemington, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Montrose and Valley Falls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 87 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 80 and 82. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Taylor; Upshur
